request_text:
I am writing to submit a request under the Louisiana Public Records Act § 44:1 et seq. and all other applicable Louisiana public record laws.  I am requesting the following records related to New Orleans City Councilwoman LaToya Wilder Cantrell, District B: 
 
 A year-by-year breakdown of Councilor Cantrell’s specific City Council base salary, including any additional compensation since December 2012. 
 Records that Councilor Cantrell is eligible for pension and health care benefits, and whether she has received those benefits since December 2012. 
 Lists or other records containing the names, dates of employment and salaries for any staff members who have worked or otherwise served in the office of Councilor Cantrell since December 2012. 
 Records reflecting any travel (both in and out of state) by Councilor Cantrell since December 2012, including, but not limited to, travel expense reports, travel itineraries, budget reports, reservations and communications. 
 Records of all expenditures submitted by, or made on behalf of, Councilor Cantrell since December 2012. These records include, but are not limited to, the following:
 
 Records of all office supply expenses for Councilor Cantrell; 
 Records of all equipment, furnishings and/or general office upgrades purchased by or for Councilor Cantrell’s personal office. Records include, but are not limited to, any and all purchase orders; 
 Records related to any City vehicles, car allowances and/or mileage reimbursements for Councilor Cantrell paid for by City funds (whether in full or in part) since December 2012; 
 Documents or records of any charges and/or payments to any City owned or paid credit or debit cards issued to Councilor Cantrell since December 2012, regardless of whether she personally signed the charges. 
 
 
 Records detailing all gifts received and/or accepted by Councilor Cantrell since December 2012, including the name of the party who gave the gift, a description of the gift, the date the gift was given and the financial value of the gift.
closure_reasons: No Response From Requester

request_text:
Dear madam: 
 This shall constitute a request on behalf of Jawad Gharib for the following public records: 
 
 Any and all records relating or referring to Docket No. 058-16, Variance Request from the provisions of Article 24, Section 24.12.D of the Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance. 
 Any and all records, including, but not limited to, documents, photographs and/or video recordings, relating or referring to Comprehensive Zoning Ordinance violations for the Property located at 4500 Old Gentilly Road, New Orleans, Louisiana 70126 from January 1, 2015 to the present. 
 
 Pursuant to La. R.S. 44:33, the City of New Orleans is required to make these records available for immediate copying and/or inspection. In the event that any such records are in active use at this time, please provide a certificate fixing a date and time, within three business days, when Mr. Gharib may inspect and copy such records, as required by La. R.S. 44:33(B)(1). 
 If more than five days, exclusive of weekends and legal holidays, elapse before the records are provided, my client is entitled to file suit seeking the issuance of a writ of mandamus, and/or injunctive or declaratory relief. La. R.S. 44:35(A). In addition, should my client prevail in obtaining a writ of mandamus or other similar relief, he is entitled to an award of attorney fees and costs. La. R.S. 44:35(D). Further, my client may also be entitled to penalties in the amount $100 per day that the production is overdue. La. R.S. 44:35(E). 
 Please provide all requested records within the applicable time delays, and do not hesitate to contact me with any questions.
closure_reasons: Closed - Waiting for Payment or Schedule Review

request_text: To whom it may concern:  Under the Louisiana Public Records Law, I am requesting records related to the case management system(s) that New Orleans Police Department personnel have used to track major felony cases, and investigatory work on major felony cases, since at least 2005, through the date in which this request is filled. If multiple case management systems have been used by the Department during that time period, I am requesting information on each of those systems.  The records should include:  - Any contracts with the company that created the case management system(s), if created by an outside company.  - The data dictionary, glossary of terms, record layout, and any other documentation that describes the case management system(s).  - The instruction manual, patrol guide, or any other type of guide, distributed to law enforcement personnel dictating how they should use the case management system(s).  I am requesting that all records be provided to me in their original electronic file format, whenever possible, which I am entitled to under the law. (The requestor can choose to receive electronic records in electronic format. St. Tammany Parish Coroner v. Doe, 48 So.3d 1241 (La.App. 1st Cir. 2010); Johnson v. City of Pineville, 9 So.3d 313 (La.App. 3d Cir. 2009).)  For example, if the department has a PDF of the instruction manual for the case management system, I am requesting that I receive that instruction manual as a PDF instead of a printed copy of the PDF.  As a member of the media reporting on matters in the public interest, I am requesting a fee waiver and an expediting of my request. However, since I am requesting records in their original electronic file format whenever possible, I expect the costs, if any, to be limited.  Under the Louisiana Public Records Law, I am entitled to a response within three days. If my request will take longer than three days to be filled, please state the reason in writing and the date I can expect to receive the records.   If you deny any portion of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.  I am requesting that communication regarding this request be conducted via email, and that the request be filled via email.  Thank you for considering my request.  Sincerely,  Sarah Ryley Reporter, The Trace Media 112 Berkeley Pl. #3R Brooklyn, NY 11217 Cell: 347-324-8697 sarahryleyfoi@gmail.com
closure_reasons: Closed - Waiting for Payment or Schedule Review

request_text:
To: custodian of records, Wisner Donation Advisory Committee and Mayor, City of New Orleans 
 This letter serves to request certain public records pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Act, Louisiana Revised Statute section 44:1, et seq.): 
 1.  I’m seeking a copy of the Wisner-BP settlement agreement entered into at some time in advance of the June 2, 2016 dismissal with prejudice of the Wisner Donation’s lawsuit against BP in U.S. District Court. I note that the motion to dismiss, filed May 26, 2016, was made on behalf of:   "the Plaintiffs, Edward Wisner Donation, Mayor Mitch J. Landrieu acting on behalf of the City of New Orleans as Trustee of the Edward Wisner Donation and the City of New Orleans individually as a beneficiary; The Administrators of the Tulane Educational Fund as a beneficiary; Board of Supervisors of Louisiana State University and Agricultural and Mechanical College as a beneficiary; The Salvation Army Inc. as a beneficiary; and the Wisner Heirs as beneficiaries identified on attached Exhibit “A” through undersigned counsel, pursuant to the Full and Final Release, Settlement, and Covenant Not to Sue entered into by the parties, ..."   Also noted is that the City of New Orleans municipal code creates the advisory committee:  https://www.municode.com/library/la/new_orleans/codes/code_of_ordinances?nodeId=PTIICO_CH2AD_ARTIVBOCOCO_DIV4EDWIDOADCO 
 "Sec. 2-159. - Function. 
 
 
 Subject to the control and direction of the council, the powers, duties and functions of the Edward Wisner Donation Advisory Committee shall be the supervision, direction and administration of all of the lands, funds and avails constituting and comprising the Wisner donation, or the avails or fruits thereof, and to consult with and advise the mayor in his capacity as trustee upon all matters pertaining to such trust and the mayor when acting upon the advice of the committee, or a majority thereof, shall be deemed to be acting for and in behalf of all the parties at interest. To that end all matters relating to the trust shall in the first instance be referred to and handled by the committee." 
 
 
 2.  I’m also seeking copies of any associated documents, including agreements between Wisner Donation and BP or other parties concerning the spending of any money the Wisner Donation has received or will receive under the agreement or under any other agreement associated with the 2010 Deepwater Horizon oil spill. 
 3.  I’m also seeking any information, including agreements, budgets and plans, for restoration of damage caused by the BP Deepwater Horizon oil spill to property owned or controlled by the Wisner Donation. 
             As you know, the Public Records Act requires that public records be provided for inspection and, if requested, copying within, at most, three days. If any of the records do not exist or will not be provided, you must notify me within, at most, three days regarding the reason(s) for the delay or refusal. 
             If you have any questions about this request, or need additional information in determining what records I am requesting, please call me at 504-826-3327 or 504-717-1157, or contact me by email at mschleifstein@nola.com. 
 Note that the Louisiana Public Records Act includes this provision:  
 §33.1. Custodian; contact information 
             Each public body that has a custodian of public records shall make the contact information of the custodian available to the public in a manner that will allow a member of the public to quickly determine the appropriate person to whom a public records request should be submitted, including by placing such information on the internet. 
 If this advisory committee or the Mayor is not the custodian of the records I request, please inform me to whom I should make this request.  
             I look forward to hearing from you soon. 
             Sincerely yours, 
 Mark Schleifstein
closure_reasons: Closed
Closed - Waiting for Payment or Schedule Review

request_text:
RE: Louisiana Public Records Request 
  Dear Sir or Madam: 
 Pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Law, R.S. § 44:1 et seq., I request that you, as the custodian of records of City of New Orleans, Department of EMS produce the following public records: 
 ⁃ All records dating May 23, 2018 - September 11, 2018 pertaining to the investigation of a grievance filed by Brandi Leonard against Captain Laura Russell that occurred on May 23, 2018 to include specifically any emails, text messages, audio recordings, memorandum, meeting minutes, hand written notes, interview audio recordings, interviewed parties, photographs, screenshots, recorded telephone conversations, and any other applicable records not found above. 
   ⁃ All records dating December 1, 2017 - September 11, 2018 in which any action or inaction of employee Brandi Leonard was of subject matter to include any disciplinary action taken against the employee as well as any notes made in personnel file. 
   ⁃ All records dating May 23, 2018- September 11, 2018 in which any action or inaction of employee Laura Russell was of subject matter to include any disciplinary action taken against the employee, as well as any notes made in personnel file. 
   ⁃ All records dating May 23, 2018-September 11, 2018 in which any employee submitted regarding any action, inaction, or complaint regarding Captain Laura Russell was of subject matter. 
 Please produce these records electronically to avoid unnecessary fees and save paper. If for any reason, my request for information cannot be sent without cost, then prior to any copying, please notify me immediately with the reasons for the denial and the cost that will be involved. 
 As you know, R.S. § 44:32(D) of the Louisiana Public Records Act requires a response to this request within three (3) business days, exclusive of Saturdays, Sundays, and legal holidays. 
 If you withhold any documents responsive to this request, please describe the material withheld and specify in detail the statutory or administrative basis for withholding it. All segregable, non-exempt parts of the documents should be provided. 
 If you deny this request pursuant to R.S. 44:34, because the records are not in your custody or control, please answer the following questions in detail: 
 1. Is a copy of the requested public record usually located in your office? 
 2. Why is your copy of the requested public record absent from your office? 
 3. Where is your copy of the requested public record? 
 4. Who has received your copy of the requested public record? 
 5. How and from whom did the present custodian gain control of your copy of the requested public record? 
 6. What was the exact time your copy of the requested public record was taken from your custody and control? 
 7. When will your copy of the requested public record be returned to your office? 
 8. Is there any other public official who has a copy of the requested public record? 
 9. State the name or names of anyone who has a copy of the requested public record. 
 10. State the location(s) where the requested public record can be viewed. 
 11. State the hours and dates when the requested public record can be viewed. 
 Please feel free to contact me at any time using the contact information listed. Thank you for your prompt attention to this matter. 
 Sincerely, 
 Brandi Leonard (985)498-8789 Brandi.e.leonard@outlook.com

 All public records requests filed with your department from 2005 to the present regarding Donald Trump, the Trump Organization or any of the aforementioned individuals or entities. 
 
 If this request would generate a substantial number of documents, I would prefer to have an index of the documents.  Of course, this request for an index does not preclude us from later requesting any or all of the documents included in the index.  Additionally, I request that the information I seek be provided, if possible, in an electronic format via a personal computer disk or CD-ROM. 
 I understand that there might be costs associated with this request.  I would request a waiver of fees and ask for you to contact either of us by telephone before making copies if this request will be in excess of $50. 
 I would appreciate your communicating with us by email at ResearchInfo@dnc.org or by telephone at (202) 798-3889, rather than by mail, if you have questions regarding this request. If all or any part of this request is denied, please cite the specific exemption which you believe justifies your refusal to release the information and inform us of your agency's administrative appeal procedures available to me under the law. I look forward to your reply within 20 business days (excluding Saturdays, Sundays and legal holidays), as the statute requires. 
 Thank you for your assistance in this matter. 
 Please send all copies to: 
 Lauren Dillon 
 430 S Capitol Street SE 
 Washington, DC 20003 
   
  Sincerely, 
 Lauren Dillon

request_text:
Hi, 
   
 Pursuant to the state’s public records law, I am requesting access to and copies of records from your agency as part of our continuing coverage of gun trafficking. I have broken the request into four parts, each of which details the records that we are seeking. As expressed below, the date range for each part of this request is January 1, 2010 to the present: 
   
 1) Detailed information on stolen guns  
  It is our understanding that law enforcement agencies keep detailed records about firearms that were reported stolen by the citizens they serve. We are therefore requesting the following for each case of reported firearm theft in your jurisdiction:  
 -- The police report number and/or incident number for the firearm theft 
 -- The serial number, make, model, caliber, type and any other descriptive information for each firearm that was reported stolen 
 I would be grateful if this data was collated into a spreadsheet where each row represents one case. Here is an example: 
   




 Case Number 


 Firearm Serial Number 


 Firearm Make 


 Firearm Model 


 Firearm Caliber 


 Firearm type 


 Other descriptive information 




 15-0001 


 1234 


 Glock 


 G31 


 0.357 


 Handgun 


 Black grip 




 15-0002 


 2345 


 Smith & Wesson 


 M&P 15 SPORT 


 5.56mm 


 Rifle 


 Scope attachment 




 15-0003 


 3456 


 Glock 


 G37 


 0.45 


 Handgun 


 Tan grip 




   
  If a database is provided, please provide the record layout and/or code sheet. The date range for this part is January 1, 2010 to the present. 
   
 2) Detailed information about crime guns  
  Second, it is our understanding that law enforcement agencies maintain detailed records about firearms that were used in crimes, recovered at crimes scenes or seized during investigations in their jurisdictions, including the make, model and serial number of each gun. We are therefore requesting the following: 
  -- The following records regarding firearms used in crimes in your agency’s jurisdiction, recovered at crime scenes, seized during investigations or otherwise recovered: the make, model, and serial number of each gun; the date of the crime and/or incident from which it was recovered; the police report number for the crime and/or incident; the type of crime the firearm was used in; and the address where the crime was committed and/or the incident occurred.  
 If your agency maintains a spreadsheet or database containing these records, we ask that you please provide that database. I would be grateful if this data was collated into a spreadsheet where each row represents one case, the same as part 1) “Detailed information about stolen guns.” If a spreadsheet is provided, please also provide a record layout and/or code sheet. 
  I would like to note that we are not at this time seeking copies of police reports or any other investigative records associated with these crimes; we are only seeking information about the firearms used and some general information about the crimes that is generally released to the public. 
  The date range for this part is also January 1, 2010 to the present. 
   
 3) Detailed information on lost, stolen or unaccounted for law enforcement guns 
  Third, it is our understanding that law enforcement agencies maintain detailed records about firearms that, while under the control and/or in the possession of their employees, went missing, were lost or stolen, or are otherwise accounted for. Therefore we request the following: 
  -- Any and all records of department-issued firearms that were lost, stolen, went missing or are otherwise accounted for. 
  -- If your department does not issue firearms, then we ask for any and all records of firearms that were lost, stolen, went missing or otherwise became unaccounted for while under the control and/or in the possession of one of your employees. 
  The records should include but not be limited to the following: 
 
 The make, model, serial number and caliber of each lost or stolen firearm 
 The location and address where the firearm was stolen 
 The date of the loss or theft. 
 The date the lost or theft was reported 
 Whether each lost or stolen firearm was recovered 
 If the lost or stolen firearm was recovered, the date and location of the recovery 
 A description of how the firearm was lost or stolen 
 Whether negligence on the part of the employee is/was suspected in the loss or theft of the firearm 
 Whether the employee in control of the firearm retired, was terminated or otherwise left the department, and if so, the date and circumstances of the employee’s departure and whether his or her gun was retrieved and/or recovered. 
 Any other individual reports and findings on the individual lost or stolen firearms 
 
 The records should include but not be limited to databases, reports, memos, internal affairs investigations, emails or other correspondence, and/or any other records. 
  The date range for this part is also January 1, 2010 to the present. 
   
  4) Number of sworn law enforcement personnel 
  Finally, the Federal Bureau of Investigation publishes annually data on the number of law enforcement officers employed by city agencies as part of its Uniform Crime Reporting program. The number of officers employed by your department was not included in the FBI’s 2015 dataset, the most recent one available. Therefore, we are requesting the following: 
  -- The number of law enforcement officers employed by your department. Please only provide the number sworn law enforcement officers, excluding all civilian employees. 
  Please label each record in a clear manner. As a news organization, we will be making information obtained from this request available to the general public and are not requesting it for commercial purposes. 
 In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you informed me of the total charges before completing my request. We request that if you send an invoice, you make it out to The Trace.  
  I would prefer the requested information be sent via an e-mail attachment if available, or a mailed CD-ROM if not. If standard mail must be used, we ask that you send the request to the following address: 
 The Trace (at WeWork) 
 Attn: Brian Freskos 
 428 Broadway 
 New York, NY 10013 
  Thank you in advance for your help with this request. I look forward to receiving your response. If you have any questions or concerns, do not hesitate to contact me on my cell phone: (919) 522-6354 
  Sincerely, 
  Brian Freskos
closure_reasons: Closed - Waiting for Payment or Schedule Review

request_text: To whom it may concern: This is a request under Louisiana Public Records Act §44:1 et seq. We hereby request disclosure of records on homicides in your agency's jurisdiction since Jan. 1, 2001 and through the latest available date. This request is for an electronic copy or extract of data describing all homicides in a standard, machine-readable data format (such as delimited or fixed text, Excel or other spreadsheet, MS-Access or dBase) that can be readily imported by database software. A pdf (Adobe Acrobat) file will not be an accepted format for a response to this request. The items of information requested for each homicide include:  Incident ID or case number (Department identifier for this homicide)  Date (Date of occurrence, or of report)  Victim last name (Example: Smith)  Victim first name (Example: John)  Victim age  Victim gender  Victim race  Victim ethnicity (Hispanic or not Hispanic)  Weapon used  Relationship (Victim relationship to offender)  Clearance status (Open / Cleared by arrest / Exceptionally cleared)  Clearance date (Date or year, if cleared)  Address (Street address of the homicide location)  City (City of the homicide location)  XY coordinates (Latitude & longitude, or similar coordinates for the location)  Circumstance (Examples: Rape, Robbery, Burglary, Larceny-theft, Motor vehicle theft, Arson, Prostitution and commercialized vice, Other sex offenses, Narcotic drug laws, Gambling, Romantic triangle, Child killed by babysitter, Brawl due to influence of alcohol, Brawl due to influence of narcotics, Argument over money or property, Other arguments, Gangland killings, Juvenile gang killings, Institutional killings, Sniper attack, Other / not specified, Unknown) This request includes an electronic copy of all code tables or lookup tables needed to interpret values inthe data. If you regard any of the requested records as subject to exemption from required disclosure under the law, we hereby request that you exercise your discretion and disclose them nonetheless. If you decide to withhold any requested records, please do not deny the entire request and release information available under the law. If you cannot fulfill certain parts of this request or certain portions must be redacted please provide any reasonable segregable portion of a requested record after removing or redacting those portions claimed to be exempt, explain in writing the justification for redacting the record, indicate the extent of any redactions on the portion of the record which is made available or published and where technically feasible indicate on the redacted portion itself the specific exemption(s) claimed. We make this request on behalf of The Washington Post, a newspaper of general circulation in the Washington D.C. metropolitan area. The records disclosed pursuant to this request will be used in the preparation of news articles for dissemination to the public. Accordingly, we request that you waive all fees in the public interest because the furnishing of the information sought by this request will primarily benefit the public and is likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of the operations or activities of the government. If, however, you decline to waive all fees, we are prepared to pay, but request that you notify us if you plan to charge before fulfilling the request. If you have any questions about this request, please do not hesitate to contact us at steven.rich@washpost.com, wesley.lowery@washpost.com, kimbriell.kelly@washpost.com or ted.mellnik@washpost.com. We look forward to your response. Sincerely, Steven Rich Wesley Lowery Kimbriell Kelly Ted Mellnik The Washington Post
closure_reasons: Denied: Burdensome and/or Voluminous

request_text:
I am requesting information on all taxicab rides completed by licensed taxicab companies within your jurisdiction from 2006 to 2016. This information is sometimes called "trip record data." As described below, I seek such information in aggregate form as well as records for each ride given. 
 
 Aggregate file  
 
 I would like to request an electronic file with information  on the total number of rides by taxi companies in your jurisdiction per day from 2006 to 2016 (i.e. this file would have 4,015 records--- 365 days* 11 years). If this information is not available on a per day basis, I request monthly totals. 
 
 Records for each taxi ride 
 
 I would like to request an electronic file with a record for each ride by each taxi company in your jurisdiction from 2006 to 2016. For each ride, I seek the following information: 
 
 Taxi company name 
 Vehicle License plate and/or taxi license number 
 Date of ride 
 Time of ride  
 Pickup location (if street address unavailable, include XY coordinates or ZIP code instead) 
 Drop-off location (if street address unavailable, include XY coordinates or ZIP code instead) 
 Distance of trip 
 Number of passengers 
 Type of dispatch (e.g., phone, hail, app, other) 
 Total fare 
 Collision occurred (i.e., indicator of whether the ride involved a collision)
closure_reasons: Denied: Burdensome and/or Voluminous

request_text:
October 21, 2016 
 To whom it may concern: 
 Under the Louisiana Public Records Act § 44:1 et seq., I am requesting an opportunity to obtain electronic records of communications between city officials and representatives of short-term rental platforms from Jan. 1, 2015 to the date of this request. 
 This should include any communication including emails, letters, memos, text messages or other physical or digital communications between city officials involved in drafting regulations on short term rentals and Airbnb, Homeaway, VRBO, or their representatives. 
 This should include:  
 • Any communications discussing ordinances for regulating short-term rentals in New Orleans or enforcing those regulations. 
 • Any draft of ordinances or city policies provided to city officials by Airbnb, Homeaway, VRBO, or their representatives. 
 • Any reports on short-term rentals in New Orleans provided to the city by Airbnb, Homeaway, VRBO, or their representatives. 
 • Any draft or final agreements between the city and Airbnb, Homeaway, VRBO, or their representatives. 
 If there are any fees for searching or copying these records onto a compact disc, please inform me if the cost will exceed $50 (including any associated delivery/postage fees). This information is not being sought for commercial purposes. 
 Section 44:32(D) of the Louisiana Public Records Act requires a response within three business days. If access to the records I am requesting will take longer than that time period, please contact me with information about when I might expect electronic copies of the requested records. 
 If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law. 
 Please feel free to call or email me with any questions on this request. 
 Sincerely, 
 Kalen Wright

Dear Public Information Officer: 
 The following request is made on behalf of Lauren M. Bergeron, a Louisiana citizen of the age of majority, under the authority of the Louisiana Public Records Act, La. R.S. 44:1-41:

Under the Louisiana Public Records Act § 44:1 et seq., I am requesting an opportunity to inspect or obtain records related to revenue the city has collected under the short term rental ordinance. 
 Specifically, I am requesting any records showing the amount that short term rentals and/or short term rental platforms have paid to the city in hotel/motel taxes and Neighborhood Housing Improvement Fund fees from Jan. 1, 2017 to the date this request is fulfilled. This request should include any total tax and fee receipts recorded by the city of New Orleans, any documentation of payment to the city of New Orleans, any voided checks, ledgers or other documentation of such payments. 
 In addition, I request any records of any disbursements from the city to other entities (including the Convention and Visitors Bureau, Convention Center, Regional Transit Authority and Orleans Parish School Board) from the proceeds of taxes collected from short term rentals or short term rental platforms. 
 If this request is denied in whole or in part, please respond in writing by citing the specific statute, ordinance or other authority that provides a valid exemption to the Louisiana Public Records Act.

Via: Form on nola.nextrequest.com 
 New Orleans Police Department 
 715 South Broad Street 
 New Orleans, Louisiana 70119 
   
 October 29th 2016 
   
 Dear Custodian of Records 
   
 This is a request under the Louisiana Public Records Act. I request the following: 
 
 Any communications between the NOPD and New Orleans City Council members regarding the sale or distribution of hard drugs—including but not limited to crystal meth—over gay hookup or dating apps—including but not limited to Grindr, Scruff, and Jack’d 
 Any communications with the Mayor of New Orleans regarding the same 
 Any communications with other law enforcement agencies regarding the same 
 Any communications with any such apps regarding the same 
 Any documents, records, communications, or other files in possession of the NOPD regarding the same 
 Copies of any previous Public Records Requests regarding the sale or distribution of hard drugs over gay hookup apps, including the contents of any fulfilled requests and denials of any denied requests 
 
   
 Please email the information to sam.stecklow@gmail.com.  
   
 FourTwoNine (fourtwonine.com) is a news, culture, and men’s lifestyle magazine. Because I, the requestor, am a journalist, and I seek the information in order to disseminate it to the public, and because the information regards the safety, welfare, and legal rights of the general public, the request meets the statutory definition of “in the public interest.” This request is not for commercial benefit as defined in the statute because this request is made by a member of the news media whose principal purpose is to access and disseminate information regarding the general public’s interest, safety, welfare, and legal rights. To the extent you intend to assess any charges, please notify me to discuss first. 
   
 Thank you for your time and prompt attention to this matter, 
   
 Sam Stecklow

request_text:
HGI requests following information under the Louisiana Public Records Act LSA-R.S. 44:31, Et Seq., and as Provided in Executive Order MJ 10-05 Paragraph 12. 
 Description of Public Record Requested: 
 
 All proposals submitted in response to the City of New Orleans’s Request for Proposals for Workers’ Compensation Claims Administration RFP No 7017-01989. 
 
 
 All records relating to the above referenced RFP that identifies the members of the Selection Committee. 
 All records and documents used in the evaluation by the Selection Committee including, recordings, notes, evaluation forms, instructions provided on the use of the evaluation forms, notes made during the evaluation by each member of the Selection Committee. 
 All communications between the Selection Committee since March 17, 2016. 
 All communications between any member of the Selection Committee and any party submitting proposals. 
 The results of any inquiry by the Chief Procurement Officer or the Office of Inspector General in to this RFP process. 
 All economic data used to determine the fairness of the price offered by each proposer. 
 All individual and composite evaluations used, viewed, including notes, erasures and corrections, and which in any way formed part of the selection process. 
 The copies of the Responses of each Respondent to the RFP that were provided to each member individual member of the Selection Committee complete with notes, calculations and erasures. 
 All documents that show how each member of the Selection Committee evaluated each response to the RFP. 
 All documents that show the reason for the city’s failure to evaluate and award the Workers’ Compensation Contract on or before June 17, 2016. 
 All documentation regarding the postponement of the Selection Committee Meeting. [note, this item was included in letter emailed to Council District D on September 19, 2016] 
 
  TIME PERIOD FOR WHICH RECORDS ARE BEING SOUGHT: March 17, 2016 to the present. 
  NAMES OF PUBLIC OFFICIALS INVOLVED: Al Delaparte, Nathaniel Celestine, Courtney Begnaris, Stephanie Landry, Tim McConnell, Norman Foster. 
  DISCLOSURE OF FEES: By making this request, HGI agrees to pay the stated fees for copying of records. HGI requests that the City contact Terrel J. Broussard, General Counsel for HGI at terrelb@hgi-global.com with a statement of the total cost before the records are actually copied.

request_text:
Dear City Secretary/County Official: 
 AEI Consultants has been retained to perform a Phase I Environmental Site Assessment (ESA) at: 
 Historical Addresses:  
 Ransom Street – 6623-6659 (odd numbers) 
 Reynes Street – 4400-4458 (Even numbers) 
 Ray Avenue – 4421-4449 (odd numbers) 
 Selma Street – 6600-6648 (even numbers) 
 AEI Project: 366076. PM: C. Stanley 
   
 For the purpose of our assessments, we would kindly request to review the following information: 
   
 Local Environmental Health Department: 
 Information on the above mentioned site that may contain information regarding environmental code violations, the storage, generation, usage, or spillage of hazardous substances, petroleum products, pollutants, or controlled substances, and any other environmental conditions for the property. 
   
 Fire Department 
 Information on the above mentioned site that may contain evidence of previous or current hazardous substance storage, generation, usage, or spillage of hazardous substances, petroleum products, pollutants, or controlled substances, any other environmental conditions, and/or for any historical information available for this site. 
   
 Building Department 
 Information on the above mentioned site including copies of Certificates of Occupancy and building permits (or permit summary) from the property’s first development to current date (year issued, type of permit, and owner/applicant) and any information which would indicate whether evidence of current or prior use or storage of hazardous substances. 
   
 Planning Department 
 Information on the above mentioned site that would indicate the existence of Activity and Use Limitations (AULs), defined as legal or physical restrictions or limitations on the use of, or access to the property.  AULs are comprised of engineering controls (physical modifications to reduce potential of exposure to hazardous substances or petroleum products in soil or ground water) and institutional controls (legal or administrative restrictions on the use of or access to a site to reduce potential of exposure to hazardous substances or petroleum products in soil or ground water, or to prevent interference with remedial actions). 
   
 We appreciate your time in reviewing our request. If you have any questions, please feel free to contact me at (214) 393-5810 or cmains@aeiconsultants.com 
   
 Respectfully, 
   
 Christie Mains (Van Wormer) 
 Research Coord/Exec Admin 
 AEI Consultants 
 15660 Dallas Parkway, Suite 820 
 Dallas, TX 75248 
 
 214.393.5810 
 480.452.8508 
 214.393.5815 
 
 www.aeiconsultants.com
closure_reasons: Closed - Waiting for Payment or Schedule Review

request_text:
I'm a senior reporter for The Guardian, based in New York. As part of a national project analyzing gun murders in cities across the country, we are requesting detailed data on your city’s 2015 murder statistics. 
   
 We are requesting: 
   
 
 
 The breakdown of the city’s 2015 murders by murder weapon (at a minimum, the count of firearm murders vs others). Please clarify if this total count includes murders only or all homicides--in other words, if it includes or excludes justifiable homicides. 
 
 
 The city’s 2015 firearm murder victims broken down by race and gender. (How many white men were murdered with guns? How many white women? How many black men? How many black women? Etc.) 
 
 
 The city’s 2015 firearm murder victims broken down by age bracket, if this data is available. 
 
 
 The number of the city’s 2015 firearm murders that were gang-related  or gang-involved, if this data is available, along with a description of how your department defines or determines gang-related or gang-involved murders. 
 
 
 The number of the city’s 2015 firearm murders that were related to domestic violence, if this data is available, along with a description of how your department defines domestic violence-related murders. 
 
 
 The police department’s 2015 and YTD 2016 murder clearance rates. 
 
 
    
 We are requesting this information in a digital format, and happy to discuss how best to obtain these statistics based on your department’s available records and record-keeping system.  
 If some of these statistics are more readily available than others, please send them as they are available.
closure_reasons: Denied: Creation of a New Record
Closed

request_text:
To whom it may concern: 
 Under the Louisiana Public Records Act § 44:1 et seq., I am requesting the opportunity to inspect and obtain records of any and all communications between city officials and representatives of short-term rental platforms from Jan. 1, 2016 to the date of this request. 
 This should include any and all communication including emails, letters, memos, text messages or other physical or digital communications between city officials involved in drafting regulations on short term rentals and Airbnb, Homeaway, VRBO or their representatives. 
 This should include: 
 - Any and all communications discussing ordinances for regulating short-term rentals in New Orleans or enforcing those regulations. 
 - Any and all draft of ordinances or city policies provided to city officials by Airbnb, Homeaway, VRBO or their representatives. 
 - Any and all reports on short-term rentals in New Orleans provided to the city by Airbnb, Homeaway, VRBO or their representatives. 
 - Any and all draft and certified final agreements between the city and Airbnb, Homeaway, VRBO or their representatives. 
 Section 44:32(D) of the Louisiana Public Records Act requires a response within three business days. If access to the records I am requesting will take longer than that time period, please contact me with information about when I may expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records. 
 If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law. 
 Please feel free to call or email me with any questions on this request. 
 Thank you for your time and cooperation.
closure_reasons: Closed - Waiting for Payment or Schedule Review

request_text:
This is a public records request for the following records: 
 
 The names of police officers/deputy sheriffs who since Jan. 1, 2006 to the present have been separated from the department under the following, or similar conditions. Please include (1) name of officer, (2) date of separation:
 
 Resigned in lieu of termination 
 Retired in lieu of termination 
 Resigned in lieu of discipline 
 Resigned in lieu of penalty 
 Voluntary resignation after proposed termination 
 
 
 
   
 Please disclose information as it becomes available.  If you regard any of these records as exempt from disclosure, I request that you exercise your discretion to disclose them (unless otherwise prohibited from doing so).  If you deny this request in whole or in part, I ask that you justify all deletions by reference to specific exemptions of the Act, and that you provide all non-exempt portions that are reasonably segregable.  I am making this request on behalf of The Washington Post. The records disclosed pursuant to this request will be used in the preparation of news articles for dissemination to the public. I request that you waive all fees in the public interest. The furnishing of the information sought by this request is likely to contribute significantly to public understanding of the operations or activities of government and is not primarily in the commercial interest of the requester.  If, however, you decline to waive all fees, I am prepared to pay your normal fees for news media requesters.  Please notify me if you expect the processing fees to exceed $100.   I look forward to your response within the allowed timeframe. Thank you.  Sincerely, 
 Kimbriell Kelly, reporter 
 (202) 302-7540 cell; (202) 334-9961 desk 
   
 Daniel Teehan, research assistant 
 (646) 251-1882 cell; dteehan@princeton.edu

request_text:
Dear custodian of records: 
 Pursuant to Louisiana Public Records Law, La. Rev. Stat. §44:1, et seq., I am requesting an opportunity to obtain copies of public records related to a murder case in 1981. The incident occurred on February 8, 1981, when a Robert Collins was murdered when an explosive device detonated his car. 
 I’m specifically seeking the jail mug shots of two men -- Clarence Michael Smith and Anthony Scire -- arrested on the charge of the murder. Both were tried for the case, found guilty on Feb 4, 1985, and sentenced to death row (State of Louisiana v Clarence Smith and Anthony Scire, Criminal District Court, Parish of Orleans, Section “G” No. 298-874). 
 In 1993, their conviction was overturned on a technicality, and they were found not guilty in a retrial in 1994. Here is some identifying information for one of the defendants (unfortunately don’t have the DOB of Scire): 
   
 CLARENCE MICHAEL SMITH – “SMITTY” 
 Caucasian 
 Male 
 DOB 3/22/44 
   
 Additionally, I’m looking for any crime scene photos, police records (complaint, arrest, warrant), or video/audio tapes related to the case.  
 If there are any fees for searching or copying these records, please inform me of the cost. I’m a representative of the news media and my request is related to news-gathering purposes. This information is not being sought for commercial purposes. 
 Should you deny my request, or any part of the request, please state in writing the basis for the denial, including the exact statutory citation authorizing the denial as required by s. 119.07(1)(d), F.S.
closure_reasons: Closed

request_text:
Documents released last year by The Intercept indicate that police departments may increasingly be using cellphone surveillance devices, formerly used only by the military and US intelligence agencies. The public has a right to know what monitoring equipment law enforcement may be using in the course of their duties, potentially at the cost of public tax dollars.   
 Therefore, pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Act § 44:1 et seq, I request any and all New Orleans Police Department invoices or procurement records relating to the procurement or purchases of any of the following items since 2012:   
 Survey Equipment BLACKFIN I, BLACKFIN II, DRT 1101B, DRT 1183B, DRT 1201C, DRT 1301C, DRT 1301B3, DRT4411B   
 Fixed Wing Geo-Location (Manned) 
 Typhon, Garuda (G-box), Carman II, Windjammer, Radiance, Raven, Deerpark, Traveler (EW FoS), Nebula, ICARUS/NVDF  PGL Payloads on UAVs 
 Twister-Firescout APG, Boeing-Schiebel S-100, GUAVA (G-Pod/STE) --LOS, GarWind/ BLOS Pod, Gilgamesh, Airhandler, BLOS Pod, RADPOD (Radiance Pod), Jagged Amber - Next Gen BLOS, Traveler Pod - T-Pod  Ground Based Geo-Location (Vehicular)   Spartacus II, Kingfish, Stingray I/II, Stargrazer III, Artemis, Artemis II, Maximus, Cyclone Mx9 (micro/Macro), Buckshot, Yellowstone, PRD-13, Hayden I/II, Sidewinder, REBUS, RadioEye   
 Direction Finding Systems THORACIC, JUGULAR 2, QUASIMODO, HEATR  Battlefield Data Recovery/SSE 
 CYBERHAWK, CELLBRITE   
 The requested procurement records should be understood to include basic information on:  -the name of the item procured -the quantity of the item procured -the requester and approver (division, bureau, office, individual, as appropriate) of the item procured -the Performance and/or Design Requirements of the item procured (intended use, function or application, compatibility etc. requirements; reference to policy, rule, statute or other act of the Legislature, etc., as appropriate) 
 -the vendor or contractor of the procured item, including their business address and contact information 
 -the estimated cost (in dollar amount) of the item procured (either through departmental funds or third-party grant or foundation funding) In the case of a grant or foundation funded item, include name and contact information on the source of the funding 
 -any request for proposal used during the search process for a vendor or contractor of the procured item 
   
 Information relating to the specifications or uses of these products can be found at this link, if it is helpful to a records request officer:   https://theintercept.com/document/2015/12/16/government-cellphone-surveillance-catalogue/  I am making this request as a journalist. I am current fellow at The Atlantic's CityLab and a frequent reporter for national outlets such as The Guardian US and The Nation magazine and am submitting this request for non-commercial purposes. My request is simple, solely limited to procurement records, and is crucial for the public's ability to understand the surveillance capabilities of law enforcement officers and to know how their tax dollars are being spent. Therefore, I request any fee waivers or expedited processing that the department may on occasion grant to reporters.   If no fee waivers are possible, I am willing to pay for reasonable fees, but I ask that these fees be itemized and justified.  If my request is denied in whole or part, I ask that you justify all deletions by reference to specific exemptions of the act. I will also expect you to release all segregable portions of otherwise exempt material. I, of course, reserve the right to appeal your decision to withhold any information or to deny a waiver of fees.  As I am making this request as a journalist and this information is of timely value, I would appreciate your communicating with me by telephone, rather than by mail, if you have questions regarding this request. I would like to receive the information in electronic format. I would prefer any documents located be sent to me via email in PDF format.  Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your prompt response to this request.
closure_reasons: Closed: No Responsive Records

Dear Freedom of Information/ Open Records Officer: 
 Pursuant to Louisiana Public Records Act § 44:1 et seq., I request from your department all publicly available documents including, but not limited to: 
 
 Email correspondence between your department and email accounts associated with the “@trumporg.com,” “@donaldtrump.com,” “@trumphotels.com” or “@trumphotelcollection.com domain names since January 1, 2000. 
 
 
 Records related tax credits or disaster tax relief for corporations, listed below, created as a result of the Gulf Zone Opportunity Act of 2005, Katrina Emergency Tax Relief Act of 2005 or National Disaster Tax Relief act of 2015 held by your department since January 1, 2000 mentioning any of the following entities or individuals:
 
 Donald Trump 
 Trump Organization 
 Trump Hotels & Casino Resorts 
 Trump Entertainment Resorts 
 Trump International Hotel & Tower 
 Trump Management Corporation 
 Trump Marks New Orleans LLC 
 Diamondhead Casino (2005 – 2008) 
 Donald Trump, Jr. 
 Ivanka Trump 
 Eric Trump 
 Allen Weisselberg 
 Michael D. Cohen 
 George Ross 
 Jim Petrus 
 Eric Danziger 
 Matthew Calamari 
 David Orowitz 
 Lawrence “Larry” Glick 
 Alan Garten

 Gulf Opportunity Zone (GO Zone) 
 Hurricane Katrina Disaster Area 
 Citizens Insurance Tax Credit (For Businesses) 
 Composite Partnership Tax 
 Enterprise Zone Tax Incentives 
 Historic Rehabilitation Tax Credit 
 New Markets Tax Credit 
 Louisiana State Commercial Tax Credit 
 Low-Income Housing Tax Credit 
 
 
 
 
 Disaster Tax Relief for Corporations:
 
 Extended Tax Deadlines 
 Special Bonus Depreciation 
 Deduction for Demolition and Clean-Up Costs 
 Net Operating Losses Carryback Extended 
 Temporary Suspension on Limits on Charitable Contributions 
 Charitable Deduction for Contributions of Food Inventory 
 Charitable Deduction for Contributions of Book Inventory to Public Schools 
 Work Opportunity Tax Credit 
 Employee Retention Tax Credit 
 Employer-Provided Housing Tax Credit 
 Rehabilitation Tax Credit Increase 
 Housing Tax Credit

 If this request would generate a substantial number of documents, I would prefer to have an index of the documents.  Of course, this request for an index does not preclude us from later requesting any or all of the documents included in the index.  Additionally, I request that the information I seek be provided, if possible, in an electronic format via a personal computer disk or CD-ROM. 
 I understand that there might be costs associated with this request.  I would request a waiver of fees and ask for you to contact either of us by telephone before making copies if this request will be in excess of $50. 
 I would appreciate your communicating with us by email at ResearchInfo@dnc.org or by telephone at (202) 798-3889, rather than by mail, if you have questions regarding this request. If all or any part of this request is denied, please cite the specific exemption which you believe justifies your refusal to release the information and inform us of your agency's administrative appeal procedures available to me under the law. I look forward to your reply within 20 business days (excluding Saturdays, Sundays and legal holidays), as the statute requires.

 Lauren Dillon

request_text:
Pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Act I am requesting that you provide me any and all statistics provided to the City of New Orleans by the Vera Institute of Justice, Inc. on its pre-trial services operations and aggregate outcome measures including failures to appear and rearrest. In addition, please produce any "snapshot" report provided to the City listing those pre-trial inmates assessed by the Vera Institute along with any charts provided to the City with each defendant's name, age, date of entry and, if applicable, release, length of stay, bond amount, risk assessment score, charge and where the individual had any probation violations.   In addition, please provide me with the following data point the Vera Institute provided to the City: 
 
 Risk assessment interviews 
 Rish appearance decisions, bond decisions made at first apparnce (ROR, PSBU and financial bond) broken down by risk category; 
 Releases: (a) the percent of assessed defendants who are released during the reporting period, broken down by risk category; (b) the percent of assessed defendants release within three days and within seven days, broken down by risk category; (c) the percent of assessed defendants who are released during the reporting period and ordered to supervision, broken down by risk category; and (d) the percent of assessed defendants who are able to secure release, broken down by ROR, PSBU and financial bond. 
 Supervision: (a) The number of people ordered to have supervision within the reporting period, and their pre-trial risk category; (b) the number of people under supervision at the end of the reporting period; (c) the number of people under supervision that were sanctioned by the court for failing to comply with the terms of release during the reporting period; and (d) the average time spent under supervision. 
 
 Finally, please provide me with all fiscal reports submitted by the Vera Institute from 2006 to the present which include all, in addition to fiscal reports, requests for reimbursement, invoices and supporting financial documentation as requested by the City of New Orleans.
responsible_department: Mayor's Office; Mayor's Office of Criminal Justice Coordination
closure_reasons: Closed - Waiting for Payment or Schedule Review

request_text:
May 8, 2017  To whom it may concern: 
 Under the Louisiana Public Records Act § 44:1 et seq., I am requesting an opportunity to inspect or obtain documentation of donations, costs and expenditures related to the removal of monuments to Robert E. Lee, P.G.T. Beauregard, Jefferson Davis and the Battle of Liberty Place whether those records are kept by the city of New Orleans or the Foundation For Louisiana, which is serving as an agent of the city to provide a public service.  This request is made pursuant to the Louisiana Supreme Court decision in 2016-C-1809 NEW ORLEANS BULLDOG SOCIETY v. LOUISIANA SOCIETY FOR THE PREVENTION OF CRUELTY TO ANIMALS, ET AL., in which the justices found that outside organizations are subject to public records laws when they serve as an "instrumentality of a municipal corporation." The Foundation's actions assisting the city in executing the requirements of Ordinance Calendar Number 31,082 through various CEAs fall within that definition.  Specifically, I am seeking:  - Any documentation of any donations received to pay for the removal of the monuments or any other actions authorized or required by Cal. No. 31,082, including the name of the donor, the amount of the donation and the date. These records should include but not be limited to copies of checks received and receipts of transactions. - Any documentation of expenditures by the city or the Foundation For Louisiana authorized or required by Cal. No. 31,082, including payments to contractors or reimbursements for work done by city employees. This should include the name of the contractors, invoices for work, estimates for the cost of work and any other documentation related to the removal. - Any other communication between the Foundation For Louisiana and the city or any outside companies or groups related to the removal of the monuments. 
 If there are any fees for searching or copying these records, please inform me if the cost will exceed $50. However, I would also like to request a waiver of all fees in that the disclosure of the requested information is in the public interest. This information is not being sought for commercial purposes. 
 Section 44:32(D) of the Louisiana Public Records Act requires a response within three business days. If access to the records I am requesting will take longer than that time period, please contact me with information about when I might expect copies or the ability to inspect the requested records. 
 If you deny any or all of this request, please cite each specific exemption you feel justifies the refusal to release the information and notify me of the appeal procedures available to me under the law.  The Foundation For Louisiana will also receive a copy of this request. 
 Please feel free to call or email me with any questions on this request. 
 Sincerely, 
 Jeff Adelson Staff writer The New Orleans Advocate
responsible_department: Media Request - Mayor's Office of Communications
closure_reasons: Closed: No Responsive Records

request_text:
October 7, 2016 
   
 Hayne Rainey 
 Press Secretary 
 Office of Mayor Mitch Landrieu 
 City of New Orleans 
 (504) 658-4945 
 chrainey@nola.gov 
   
                         Re: Request for Public Records 
   
 Dear Hayne: 
   
             This letter serves to request certain public records pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Act, Louisiana Revised Statute section 44:1, et seq.): 
 I’m seeking a copy of the Wisner-BP settlement agreement entered into at some time in advance of the June dismissal with prejudice of the Wisner Donation’s lawsuit against BP in U.S. District Court. I’m also seeking copies of any associated documents, including agreements between Wisner Donation and BP or other parties concerning the spending of any money the Wisner Donation has received or will receive under the agreement or under any other agreement associated with the 2010 Deepwater Horizon oil spill. 
 I’m also seeking any information, including agreements, budgets and plans, for restoration of damage caused by the BP Deepwater Horizon oil spill to property owned or controlled by the Wisner Donation. 
             As you know, the Public Records Act requires that public records be provided for inspection and, if requested, copying within, at most, three days. If any of the records do not exist or will not be provided, you must notify me within, at most, three days regarding the reason(s) for the delay or refusal. 
             If you have any questions about this request, or need additional information in determining what records I am requesting, please call me at 504-826-3327 or 504-717-1157, or contact me by email at mschleifstein@nola.com. 
             I look forward to hearing from you soon. 
             Sincerely yours, 
            Mark Schleifstein
closure_reasons: No Records: Not custodian

request_text:
City/Parish Government (CPG) Traffic Camera Safety Program (TCSP) (or whatever other term may be used to refer to the jurisdiction’s traffic camera program) Information Request (where possible please provide electronic (.xls, .csv, .txt, etc.) responses to GarofaloR@legis.la.gov) General Questions: 
  1) List of all existing TCSP traffic cameras including location/intersection, type (speed, signal, etc.), 
  2) List of all proposed TCSP traffic cameras including location/intersection, type (speed, signal, etc.), 
  3) List of all existing/proposed TCSP mobile traffic cameras including type (speed, signal, etc.), make and model of vehicle, color of vehicle, and a photo of the vehicle, 
  4) Name, contact information, and cellular telephone number for the person responsible for deciding where the cameras are located, 
  5) General written criteria used to decide where TCSP cameras (including mobile) are (will be) located, 
  6) Specific criteria/reason used to choose the location for each existing and each proposed TCSP camera, 
  7) Specific criteria/reason used to choose the location(s) for each existing and each proposed mobile TCSP camera, 
  8) Name and contact information for the TCSP’s contract provider (if there are multiple providers, please provide the information for each installed camera), 
  9) Name, contact information, and cellular telephone number for the representative (person) of the TCSP’s contract provider (if there are multiple providers, please provide the information for each installed camera), 
  10) Name, contact information, and cellular telephone number for the specific CPG person responsible for administering the TCSP, 
  11) Name, contact information, and cellular telephone number for every lobbyist who is now or has ever represented the CPG regarding the TCSP, (lobbyist is defined as any individual or entity that is/was in any way involved with educating/influencing the decision to implement the TCSP) a. For each lobbyist, please state whether he/she is/was paid by the CPG or by the TCSP contract provider. b. For each lobbyist, please state whether or not any part of the compensation paid to said lobbyist is now or was ever calculated based on a percentage of any revenue derived from the TCSP and if so, describe the payment calculation method specifically. c. For each lobbyist, please state the total payments received by said lobbyist relating to the CPG TCSP for each of the last five years. d. For each lobbyist, please state the total payments received by said lobbyist relating to the CPG TCSP since the inception of the TCSP. 
  12) Name, contact information, and cellular telephone number for every lobbyist who is now or has ever represented the TCSP contract provider, (lobbyist is defined as any individual or entity that is/was in any way involved with educating/influencing the decision to implement the TCSP) a. For each lobbyist, please state whether he/she is/was paid by the CPG or by the TCSP contract provider. b. For each lobbyist, please state whether or not any part of the compensation paid to said lobbyist is now or was ever calculated based on a percentage of any revenue derived from the TCSP and if so, describe the payment calculation method specifically. c. For each lobbyist, please state the total payments received by said lobbyist relating to the CPG TCSP for each of the last five years. d. For each lobbyist, please state the total payments received by said lobbyist relating to the CPG TCSP since the inception of the TCSP. 
  13) A copy of the original and all subsequent addendum(s) to the contract with the TCSP camera provider, including the addendum (or new contract) for the proposed additional cameras (if there are multiple providers, please provide the information for each installed camera) 
  14) All communications of any manner including, but not limited to, electronic mail, facsimile, text, printed document, memo, etc. between any/all CPG officials (elected and/or employed) and the TCSP camera contract provider 
  15) All communications of any manner including, but not limited to, electronic mail, facsimile, text, printed document, memo, etc. between any/all CPG officials (elected and/or employed) and any lobbyist who represented either the CPG or TCSP regarding any aspect (including but not limited to compensation) of the TCSP 
  16) All internal communications of any manner including, but not limited to, electronic mail, facsimile, text, printed document, memo, etc. between any CPG official (elected and/or employed) regarding the TCSP, the contract provider, the selection of said provider, or the selection of the specific locations for camera installation Revenue Questions: 1) Total revenue derived from the TCSP for each of the last 5 years, 2) Total projected additional revenue for the additional proposed TCSP cameras, 3) The percentage of TCSP revenue that is paid to the TCSP contract provider, 4) The total amount that has been paid to the TCSP contract provider for each of the last 5 years, 5) The total amount that has been paid to the TCSP contract provider since the inception of the TCSP, Statistical Questions: 1) For each existing TCSP camera, the date that the camera was first used to issue civil penalties (“Operational Date”), 
  2) For the 12-month period prior to each TCSP camera becoming operational, for each existing camera location, the number of: a. Fatalities, b. Accidents, c. Traffic citations issued by the local law enforcement agency, d. Crashes within 150 feet from both directions from the center of the intersection 
  3) For the 12-month period subsequent to each TCSP camera becoming operational, for each existing camera location, the number of: a. Fatalities, b. Accidents, c. Traffic citations issued by the local law enforcement agency, d. Traffic civil penalties issued by camera, e. Crashes within 150 feet from both directions from the center of the intersection 
  4) For each proposed additional TCSP camera location, for the 12-month period subsequent to each camera becoming operational, for, the number of: a. Fatalities, b. Accidents, c. Traffic citations issued by the local law enforcement agency, d. Traffic civil penalties issued by camera, e. Crashes within 150 feet from both directions from the center of the intersection 
  5) Total number of civil penalties issued at each TCSP camera for EACH of the last 5 years, broken-down by offense, and including for each offense category (speeding, failing to come to a complete stop when turning right on red, running a red light, etc.): a. Total number b. Percentage of total penalties issued for that location c. Total fines d. Total fees e. Number of penalties paid f. Number of penalties unpaid g. Number of citations issued to minorities h. The percentage of tickets that are waived or overturned 
  6) List of every traffic signal within the territorial boundary of the CPG including: a. The intersection cross-streets, b. The exact length of time that the signal is yellow in each direction (including turning lanes), c. Whether the signal is monitored by the TCSP, d. If monitored by the TCSP, the specific direction that is monitored, e. If monitored by the TCSP, the exact length of time that the signal is yellow for each specific direction that is monitored

request_text:
... 
 RE:     February 22, 2017 Public Records Act Request requesting documents related to JOB16113103; MO6112097; AV5107837; AV6106690. 
 Dear City of New Orleans Law Dept.:           
 Pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Law, La. R.S. § 44:1 et seq., we write to request copies of the following records in the possession, custody, or control of the City of New Orleans. This request is made by STAND with Dignity (“Stand”) on behalf of its members and community members. 
 On August 6th, 2016, the New Orleans City Council unanimously adopted Ordinance Calendar No. 30,550, the “Living Wage Ordinance. “Codified as New Orleans, Louisiana Code of Ordinances Sec. 70-801 et seq., the purpose of this article is to ensure that when taxpayer-funded benefits are extended by the city to private business, they are used in a way that benefits the city as a whole. Stand with Dignity is working with affected workers and concerned community members to ensure that city-funded projects are in compliance with the city’s order. We are committed to remaining engaged to call on the city of New Orleans to enforce this policy in order to ensure meaningful change for families in New Orleans. 
   
 ...  
 ... 
  Stand hereby requests the following records in relation to four specific city-funded projects. Information requested from: 
 1. Purchase Order JOB16113103 on amendment to Arbor E&T to manage JOB1 
 Vendor Name: Arbor E&T 
 Purchasing requisition number: RXQ 772 2016409-01a, RXQ 772 2016415-01a, PC 772 00000037848, RXQ 772 2016410-01a, PC 772 00000037460, RXQ 772 2016411-01a, PC 772 00000037461,PC 772 00000037459, RXQ 772 2016412-01a, RXQ 772 2016413-01a, PC 772 00000037569, RXQ 772 2016414-01a and 16136128 from buyspeed 
 Contract beginning date: 08/31/2016 
  2. Purchase Order MO6112097 on amendment- special events New Orleans Convention Company 
 Vendor Name:New Orleans Convention Company, Inc 
 Purchasing requisition number: 16135029 
 Contract beginning date: 08/01/2016 
  3. Purchase Order AV5107837on non-signatory lease agreement with Air Canada 
 Vendor Name: Air Canada 
 Purchasing requisition number: n/a 
 Contract beginning date: 03/31/2016 
  4. Purchase Order AV6106690 on amendment to agreement with United Airlines 
 Vendor Name: Unites Airlines 
 Purchasing requisition number: n/a 
 Contract beginning date: 03/01/2016 
   
 Specific records requested: 
 
 All bidding documents. 
 All contract documents related to these agreements. 
 A list of the covered employers (contractors, sub-contractors, and beneficiaries) governed under these contracts. 
 The names of all “temp” services used to staff jobs governed under these contracts. 
 All documentation of third party staffing services used to staff jobs under these contracts. 
 All documentation of payroll records, pursuant to section, 70-810(1), pertaining to employees governed under these contracts. 
 The name of the agent who processes complaints pursuant to section 70-810(4) of the Ordinance. 
 A list of jobsite locations governed by these contracts. 
 
 If all or any part of this request is denied, please list the specific exemptions that are being claimed to withhold information and who we can speak with to get more information about the denial. If you determine that some portions of the requested information are exempt, we expect that the Law Department will provide the non-exempt portions. If you are not the custodians of the documents, please direct us to the more appropriate agency. We reserve the right to appeal any decision to withhold information and expect that the Law Department will list the address and office where such an appeal can be sent. 
 Pursuant to La. R.S. § 44.33, I ask that this information be sent to my office via facsimile and email within the five days allowed by statute. If the Department is unable to send the information via facsimile, please contact me and I will arrange to have someone pick up a copy of documents on a CD-ROM. Documents may be emailed to satri@nowcrj.org. Documents may be faxed to (504) 309-5205.

February 27, 2017                                    
   
 Mary Kay Kleinpeter-Zamora, Chief Procurement Officer 
 City of New Orleans, LA 
 1300 Perdido St 
 New Orleans, LA 70112 
 RE: RFP #4051-02098 
 Dear Ms. Kleinpeter-Zamora: 
 Under the Louisiana Public Records Act § 44:1 et seq., we are requesting an opportunity to inspect or obtain copies of public records that include all RFP responses, evaluator score sheets, summary score sheets, and other documentation provided to evaluators for the following RFP:  
  4051-02098 (Enterprise Resource Planning (ERP) System)

  We do not require copies of company financial statements or individual resource profiles/resumes/information. We do not require a copy of the RFP response for Sierra-Cedar/Workday as described in the table above but would request that score sheets as described above be provided for all proposers, including Sierra-Cedar/Workday. 
 If there are any fees for searching or copying these records, please inform us if the cost will exceed $500.00.  We do not require that records produced be in paper format and are happy to receive files in electronic PDF format if that is possible. 
  Copies in electronic or paper format should be sent to: 



 



 Electronic Copies including PDF (please limit email attachments to 50 mb.) 


 FOIA.Response@itserveco.com 




 Paper Copies should be mailed to: 


 FOIA Response c/o Donna Pickering 




   


 ITServeco 




   


 1255 Alderman Drive 




   


 Alpharetta, GA 30005-4156 




    

 



   


 Telephone 678-385-7579

request_text:
Pursuant to the Louisiana Public Records Act, for the date range January 1, 2015 to August 1, 2017, and for defendants arrested for Class A and Class B misdemeanors only, please provide any and all statistics provided to the City of New Orleans by the Vera Institute of Justice, Inc. on its pre-trial services operations and aggregate outcome measures, specifically including failures to appear and rearrest. In addition, please produce any "snapshot" report provided to the City listing those pre-trial inmates assessed by the Vera Institute along with any charts provided to the City with each defendant's name, age, date of entry and, if applicable, release, length of stay, bond amount, risk assessment score, charge and where the individual had any probation violations.   In addition, please provide the following: 
 
 Releases: (a) the percent of assessed defendants who are released during the reporting period, broken down by risk category; (b) the percent of assessed defendants release within three days and within seven days, broken down by risk category; (c) the percent of assessed defendants who are released during the reporting period and ordered to supervision, broken down by risk category; and (d) the percent of assessed defendants who are able to secure release, broken down by ROR, PSBU and financial bond. 
 Supervision: (a) The number of people ordered to have supervision within the reporting period, and their pre-trial risk category; (b) the number of people under supervision at the end of the reporting period; (c) the number of people under supervision that were sanctioned by the court for failing to comply with the terms of release during the reporting period; and (d) the average time spent under supervision. 
 Failures to appear and new criminal activity: (a) the percent of assessed defendants who failed to appear after release on ROR, PSBU, or financial bond, broken down by risk category and method of release (ROR, PSBU, or financial bond); (b) the percent of assessed defendants who were re-arrested for new criminal activity after release on ROR, PSBU, or financial bond, broken down by risk category (ROR, PSBU, or financial bond). 
 If applicable, the total number of assessed defendants detained on no bond.  
 
Please provide the records in electronic format. If there are fees in excess of $25 associated with this request, please contact me to discuss.
responsible_department: Mayor's Office of Criminal Justice Coordination
closure_reasons: Closed: No Responsive Records

Dear City Offical, 
 AEI Consultants is currently conducting a Property Condition Assessment for the property located at: 620 Opelousas Avenue, New Orleans, LA 70114.  AEI Project: 372571. PM: C. Allen.  
 As part of this assessment, I am required to request the following information concerning this property from departments within the City of Billings , including, but not limited to, the following:                  
 
 Copies of Certificates of Occupancy 
 Copies of any outstanding violations by the Fire and Building Departments

request_text:
Dear Ms. Kleinpeter-Zamora: 
 On behalf of HG New Orleans Retailer JV (Hudson JV), we hereby request from you in your official capacity, as the chief procurement officer  and as the custodian of records, any and all documentary materials, as defined in the Louisiana Public Records Act (La. Rev. Stat. 44:1 et seq), submitted by any person, including but not limited to Paradies Lagardere, Pacific Gateway, and/or the Aviation Board, in response to the protest filed by Hudson JV related to RFP No. 8910-02071. 
 As you are aware, the Louisiana Public Records law sets forth the time within which a custodian must respond to a public records request and provides certain rights and penalties for a custodian’s failure to comply with the statutory requirements.  Any party who is improperly denied access to records has a right of action against the custodian withholding the records pursuant to La. Rev. Stat. 44:35.  If successful, the prevailing party may be awarded reasonable attorney’s fees, litigation costs, and statutory penalties if the court finds the custodian acted unreasonably or arbitrarily failed to the respond as required by La. Rev. Stat. 44:32. 
 Please advise when the materials responsive to this request are ready for my review and notify me of any costs.  If any documentary materials are in active use and not immediately available, please certify that in writing to me and provide a time within three days of when I can gain access to the records as required by La. Rev. Stat. 44.33.        
 Thank you for your assistance in this matter.  If additional information is needed for this request, please do not hesitate to contact us.  We look forward to your response in compliance with your duties under the Louisiana Public Records Act.  Justin Boron Associate Adams and Reese LLP 701 Poydras Street, Suite 4500 New Orleans, LA 70139 Direct: 504-585-0854 Cell: 706-247-6369 Fax: 506-566-0210 E-mail: justin.boron@arlaw.com

HGI requests following information under the Louisiana Public Records Act LSA-R.S. 44:31, Et Seq., and as Provided in Executive Order MJ 10-05 Paragraph 12.

 All records relating to the above-referenced RFP that identifies the members of the Selection Committee. 
 All records and documents used in the evaluation by the Selection Committee including, recordings, notes, evaluation forms, instructions provided on the use of the evaluation forms, notes made during the evaluation by each member of the Selection Committee. 
 All communications between the Selection Committee since March 17, 2016.
