request_text:
Pursuant to the Public Records Act of Louisiana, R.S. 44:1 et seq., we request copies of the public records described below. For purposes of this request, the term “documents” includes, but is not limited to, any memoranda, letters, electronic mail or “e-mail,” handwritten, typed, or electronic notes, recordings of any kind and in any form (video, audio, digital, etc.) 
   
 
 All documents referencing the public process related to the acquisition of BriefCam’s video analytics platform, including but not limited to meeting agendas, meeting minutes, public notice, communications between your office and elected leaders, and analyses. 
 All correspondence between City of New Orleans employees and BriefCam, including but not limited to e-mails, calendar invitations, and instant messages. 
 All documents referencing the purchase of BriefCam products, including requests for proposal, purchase orders, invoices, grant applications, sole source letters or justifications, and budget requests. 
 All documents referencing draft or finalized agreements related to video analytics, including e-mail negotiations, contracts, memoranda of understanding, terms of service, and master services agreements.   
 
             Under the provisions of R.S. 44:32, if you raise a question as to whether any of the records requested is a public record, you are required to notify in writing the person making the request of your determination and the reasons, including the legal basis therefor.  Notice shall be made within three days of the receipt of the request, exclusive of Saturdays, Sundays and legal public holidays.  If you claim exemption for a record or records under the Public Records Act, or any other statute, include for each record the section of law under which exemption is claimed and your reasons for believing the statute is applicable to the record. 
   
             Under the provisions of R.S. 44:33, if the public record is not immediately available, you are required to certify this in writing promptly, and in your certificate fix a day and hour within three days, exclusive of Saturdays, Sundays and legal public holidays, for the exercise of the right granted in the Public Records Act. 
   
             Under R.S. 44:34, “If any public record applied for by any authorized person is not in the custody or control of the person to whom the application is made, such person shall promptly certify this in writing to the applicant, and shall in the certificate state in detail to the best of his knowledge and belief, the reason for the absence of the record from his custody or control, its location, what person has custody of the record and the manner and method in which, and the exact time at which it was taken from his custody and control.  He shall include in the certificate ample and detailed answers to inquiries of the applicant which may facilitate the exercise of the right granted by this Chapter.” 
   
             If you are invoking R.S. 44:34 to deny this request, please answer the following questions in detail. 
   
 
 Is a copy of the requested public record usually located in your office? 
 Why is your copy of the requested public record absent from your office? 
 Where is your copy of the requested public record? 
 Who has received a copy of the requested public record? 
 How and from whom did the present custodian gain control of your copy of the requested public record? 
 What was the exact time your copy of the public record was taken from your custody and control? 
 When will your copy of the requested public record be returned to your office? 
 Is there any other public official who has a copy of the requested record? 
 What is/are the name(s) of anyone who has a copy of the requested public record? 
 What is/are the location(s) where the public record can be viewed? 
 What are the hours and dates when the requested public record can be viewed? 
 
   
             Please contact us at the number above when the requested materials are ready to be mailed. We request that any and all documents that are available be made available in electronic form. This request includes any documents that are in paper form but that can be scanned to electronic form, as well as digital copies of any recordings.  For those documents that cannot be produced in electronic form, if the cost of copies does not exceed $50.00, proceed without further approval and send us an invoice with the records; otherwise, call to advise and gain approval to proceed.  As you are aware, failure to abide by the Public Records Law may result in certain penalties and the award of attorney’s fees.  We trust that you will comply without the necessity of any further action on our part. 
   
                                                                         Sincerely, 
                                                                         Alanah Odoms Hebert, 
                                                                         Executive Director 
                                                                         ACLU of Louisiana

request_text:
Hello, My name is Kerry P. Gibson and I live at 1501 Kabel Dr., Algiers 70131. 
 I am disabled and I have been eligible and received a "FREEZE" assessment on my home which I own for many years now. 
 Apparently according to the Assessor's office I did not file for my freeze for the tax year 2017 by the deadline and my tax bill which gets paid by my mortgage company has almost tripled from around $500.00 to now at $1,200.00.2 
 I am now told by the assessors office staff that my freeze assessment for future years will be at this new much higher amount. 
 The 2 post cards sent out to me reminding me to come in and apply for the assessment have NO DEADLINE printed on them. 
 I was not able to come in by the assessor office deadline because I was not able to leave my home due to major surgery done on me on June 15th, 2017. I had to heal and recuperate from that surgery. 
 I tried and requested to speak with Assessor Errol Williams on multiple occasions and even after writing him three different letters and He never would meet with me, only sent out his position on the matter in his letters of response to the letters that I sent him. 
 He did tell me that there were other avenues that I cold pursue in order to have my "PROPERTY TAX FREEZE" put back where it belongs retroactively. 
 But Mr. Errol Williams did not tell what these avenues are! 
 So, I am requesting 2 things. 
 1.  I want to make a formal complaint about the way I am being treated by the Assessor's office and Mr. Errol Williams for not letting me speak with him about my Freeze Assessment.  
 2. I would like to know from whatever department needs to see this either the "Legal Department of City Hall" and/or the "Assessor's office" how to go about making the request to have my assessment on my property tax bill for my home "rolled back retroactively" to where it belongs because I can prove that I am "Permanently  Disabled" and to have the over charge of my property tax bill refunded to me through the revenue department. 
 If there is a way to get this done, Assessor Errol Williams should have provided me the proper protocol on how to het this done, he just hinted in a letter to me that this was an avenue I could pursue but did not tell me anything else on how to get this done. 
 Thank You 
 Kerry P. Gibson  
 1501 Kabel Dr. 
 Algiers, la. 70131 
 ph. (504) 392-5329 home 
 ph. (504) 914-4650 cell
closure_reasons: Not a Request

request_text:
Pursuant to the Lousiana Public Records Act, La. R.S. 44:1 through 41, and the Constitution of the State of Louisiana, Article XII § 3, we hereby request that a copy of the documents and materials listed below be provided for examination and copying. Upon furnishing access to these materials, we ask that you please confirm that the materials are true and correct copies of the file prepared and/or maintained by your office and that the documents are from an official government record. If it is your position that any portion of the requested records are exempted from disclosure, we ask that you provide us with an index of those documents and disclose any reasonably segregable non-exempt portions of the documents. 
 
 For purposes of this public records request, the following definitions apply:
 
 “Project” shall mean the project known as Habana Outpost or Café Habana or any other name and/or properties bearing municipal addresses 1036, 1038, and 1040 Esplanade Avenue and/or 1324 North Rampart Street, New Orleans, Louisiana. 
 “Employees of the City of New Orleans, Office of Safety and Permit” shall mean current or former employees of the City of New Orleans, Office of Safety and Permits, including but not limited to Zachary R. Smith. 
 “Employees of Rozas Ward Architects” shall mean current or former employees of Rozas Ward Architects, including but not limited to Myles Martin. 
 “Between and among” shall mean sent by one party identified herein to another party identified herein. 
 
 
 Please provide for examination and copying the following documents: 
 
 All correspondence and things (including but not limited to email, letters, text messages and otherwise) related to the Project from January 2012 until present, between and among: 
 Employees of the City of New Orleans Department of Safety and Permits on the one hand 
 And 
 Neel Choudhury; Sean Meenan; “Sean Meenan Assistant;” and/or Employees of Rozas Ward Architects on the other hand. 
                                                                                                                                                                                               We certify that this request is made for the purpose of gathering information relative to the noted property and is not intended for commercial use. We will be pleased to pay any reasonable cost incurred in complying with and copying the requested documents, but we would like to examine the documents before copying. Please let us know when the examination may proceed pursuant to the cited statutory authority. Please e-mail all responsive information to this request to jaroberts@shieldsmott.com.

request_text:
EBI Consulting (EBI) is conducting a Phase I Environmental Site Assessment (ESA) at St. Martin's Manor located at 1501 N. Johnson Street, New Orleans, LA, 70116. As part of the ESA process, we would like to request access to inspect records regarding the following, as applicable: 
 
 Current and historical building permits 
 Current and historical Certificates of Occupancy 
 Dates of public sewer and water connection 
 Installation or removal of storage tanks (above and underground) 
 Hazardous materials storage or release 
 Hazardous waste generation or discharge 
 Asbestos or lead-based paint abatement 
 
  If these records are available, EBI field personnel will be stopping by to review these records in the next several days. We understand that these records may not be available.If there are any questions or concerns, please do not hesitate to contact us.
closure_reasons: No Longer Needed

request_text:
Hello, This is Kerry P. Gibson 1501 Kabel Dr. Algiers, La. 70131. 
 I would like to request each and every application for and awards to the owners of the CPNC and/or any limousine permits awarded to the "Owner" and the "Lessee" of the "for hire" vehicle with the license plate number QNLM 451 La. with the numbers LM 451 on the lower rear quarter panels on this Black 2015 Ford Expedition. 
 I would like all available records showing current addresses of the Owners of these CPNC numbers, the names of all the "agents", "owners," "principle's" of all registered Companies, Corporations, Limited Liability Companies and any other pertinent information on the individuals owning and leasing this same vehicle which slammed into the back of me causing serious injuries to me and over $6,000.00 property damage to my 2009 Lincoln MKS. I need this information in order for me to hold the individual who committed this felony hit and run responsible for my damages,  both physical and property and for me to be able to take appropriate legal action against those determined to be responsible. Thank You for your assistance in this very serious matter. Kerry Gibson
closure_reasons: Closed - Waiting for Payment or Schedule Review

request_text:
To Whom it May Concern: 
 We are a local community small business specializing in digital solutions for New Orleanians. As part of the growing Tech industry, we are always in need of high quality data. In particular, our project needs data for the GPS coordinates for Orleans Parish traffic cameras (speeding and red light). Our team has already assembled a list of locations (according to intersections and major landmarks).  Please accept our information request and make the GPS coordinates of traffic cameras available. This will enable us to reference your authoritative and high quality data as our continuing source of information for our Tech projects.
closure_reasons: Closed
